content.description: Stick the first and gain a delicate stance on good feet before pulling into some interesting side pull moves following the incipient seams upward to good crimps and a slopey finish. Finish on easier ground above to grassy ledge and anchors.
content.location: Far downstream. Left slab with large tree directly at the base.

content.description: Start on good horizontal and boulder up past first 2 bolts to easier ground. After a good stance at narrow ledge at mid-height, follow bolt line up excellent face to anchors.
content.location: River's Bend: Far left (downstream) of wall. Gray face.

content.description: Climb lose face to first bolt, then follow very nice crack up slab to large shelf above. A final and committing move puts you passed last bolt to anchors.
content.location: River's Bend: Mid-wall. Scramble up access trail to high ledge. Route starts on ledge twenty feet right of access trail's top (second sport route right of trail's top).

content.description: Climb up easy ground to high first bolt then move onto steep slab. Climb increasingly harder moves to tricky crux near top. Finish on sharp crimps to jug and anchors.
content.location: River's Bend: Far right (upstream) of wall. First sport climb you come to if bushwhacking from parking lot.
River's Bend: Left of wall (downstream), just L of Wish I Were a Fisherman. Starts underneath an overhang on large boulders.

content.description:
Climb dusty horizontal rock past the first bolt to a ledge, there is some choss in this section.

Move up and left on better rock past 4 more bolts using generally good holds to a perch on the arete. Work up the arete on nice rock using small crimps, sidepulls, and a couple nice pockets. A long reach up to the last bolt marks the crux, but a couple more crimpy moves are needed to get to the anchor.
content.location: Right end of the center section of the wall (defined as the section of wall with the high ledge trail), 2 routes right of the arch.

content.description: Climb ramp to bulge, then pull a series of technical moves and throw to ledge at mid-height. Finish up on easier ground to a high ledge and anchors above.
content.location: River's Bend: Far left of wall (downstream). Start on head high boulder, immediate left of small cave.

content.description:
Climb above the ledge using somewhat hard to find crimps and underclings to a good pocket at the 2nd bolt. Figure out the body tension and positioning to work through the next series of pinches, sidepulls, and smeared feet to a good jug at the 4th bolt (clip the 3rd bolt from a tenuous stance along the way). From here the climb eases a little and you can find a good rest in the small cave.

The upper portion of the climb stays wet (or muddy) for a while after a rain.
content.protection: 7 fixed chains to 2-bolt drop-in anchor. Anchor bolt for belayer on the ledge.
content.location: Right side of Riverbend area. Starts on a ledge 15 feet up from the river, climb up just left of the bonsai-like tree and traverse left onto the ledge. Of the routes that start on this ledge, Southside is the 2nd route from the left.

content.description: Climb chossy lower part to first bolt then stem your way up the excellent dihedral through small bulge near top and then anchors.
content.location: River's Bend: Right side of wall (upstream). Starts ten feet left of pine growing out of wall.

content.description: Scramble up easy ground for 10 feet, then make long reaches between jugs to a few crimps and then a side-pull and undercling crack. Check out the crimpy and sequential crux from a good stance in the corner crack. You can reach up and clip the 4th bolt from here. Look for high feet to work up crimps to more positive pockets above the crux bulge. Climb easier rock up the corner to the anchors.
content.location: Right side of Riverbend area. Just left of bonsai-like tree sticking out of wall about 10 feet up.

content.description:
This is a great route which requires good body position and balance, more than pure strength. The climbing is very fun. May be soft for the grade once you figure out the moves.

Climb carefully through choss past 2 bolts to the first chain. Stand up on the rock point to engage the blank section of wall. Work up crimps to angled holds in the first overhang and find the body positioning and pinches to reach an undercling under the second overhang. Work up a sidepull and crimps to reach jugs in the final overhang. Finish up the undercling / side pull / kneebar crack system to the final 2 bolts of easier climbing.
content.location: Right side of riverbend, through the most overhanging section of rock, identifiable by a rock point below a blank orange face.

content.description: Stick the first and pull past a dusty jug rail with some powerful moves leading into a delicate stance. Move up and right to the white undercling where a detached flake used to live. Reach through a couple more tenuous side pull moves before the slopey finish.
content.location: Far downstream. Notably features a large orange white space where a flake has since gone.

content.description: Start behind large tree on orange stone, up and right through bulges to the top.

Right start (left start is the 5.12b version). Climb up to crack under small roof, then undercling and smear your way up smooth face pass 2 bolts. Round arête to slab and a welcomed stance. Continue up through nice slab and face to anchors above.
content.location: Rivers Bend: Mid-wall. Scramble up access trail to high shelf. Route is thirty feet left of access trails top and twenty feet right of large, partially detached arch.

content.description:
Start just behind the dead tree at the base of the cliff and climb up a little right of the 1st bolt to stay on better rock. From here, use pinches, crimps and side pulls to work up past 2-3 short, more difficult sequences, separated by decent stances.

There is a full rest with good holds at a horizontal ledge, just before the 4th bolt and crux. Work up crimps to two stacked crimp nubs a few feet above the ledge. Move your feet up and reach high to a sharp side pull crimp / pocket, pull hard and continue up the diagonal crack on better holds. Clip the last bolt and layback the crack to the top.
content.location: Right side of River Bend, 2nd route from the right.

content.description: Climb the dihedral past an early crux, and onto an easing face. Frequently dirty due to debris from above.
content.location: River's Bend: Middle of wall, just R of Hellcat. Starts underneath a bulge and moves into a dihedral.
